summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch / Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. It demands extensive financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein and associated accounts from January 1, 2010, onward. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks financial records for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein, identified by his date of birth and SSN, as part of a grand jury investigation into alleged federal criminal violations.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to Andrew Stemmer at Deutsche Bank's New York branch, indicating he is the point of contact for compliance with the document request.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signed the subpoena and the accompanying cover letter requesting non-disclosure.

connections.person2: Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch / Deutsche Bank Securities Inc.
connections.description: The subpoena demands extensive financial records from Deutsche Bank related to accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a bank-client relationship.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Deutsche Bank to appear before the grand jury on July 25, 2019, to testify and produce records, though personal appearance can be avoided if records are produced by that date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: 60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005 (Deutsche Bank address)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of federal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
It seeks a comprehensive set of financial records from Deutsche Bank related to Jeffrey Epstein and associated accounts for the period from January 1, 2010, to the present (July 2019).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests Deutsche Bank to refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.

The requested records include 'Know Your Customer' filings, account statements, wire transfers, loan files, currency transaction reports, internal memoranda, and even surveillance video/photos of transactions.
